alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Fayette; Greene (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 06 at 1:35PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF FAYETTE, NORTHEASTERN CLINTON AND SOUTHEASTERN GREENE COUNTIES THROUGH 215 PM EDT... At 135 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located near Sabina, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph, pea size hail, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Washington Court House, Wilmington, Sabina, Jeffersonville, Bloomingburg, Staunton, Good Hope, Bowersville, Port William, Milledgeville, Octa, Melvin, Rosemoor, Bloomington, Jasper Mills, Reesville, Madison Mills, Rock Mills and Interstate 71 at US Route 35. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 53 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 700 PM EDT for central, southwestern and west central Ohio. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
